knimeNode.name: Credentials Widget
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a Credentials input widget for use in components views. Outputs a credentials flow variable with a given value.

intro.p: Creates a credentials input widget for use in components views. Outputs a credentials flow variable with a given value.

The node supports custom CSS styling. You can simply put CSS rules into a single string and set it as a flow variable 'customCSS' in the node configuration dialog. You will find the list of available classes and their description on our documentation page.

fullDescription.option: A descriptive label that will be shown in the view.
Some lines of description that will be shown in the view, for instance by means of a tooltip.
Parameter identifier for external parameterization (e.g. batch execution).

option.name: Prompt user name in widget view

fullDescription.option: Whether the username should be a separate field in the widget view, e.g. in KNIME WebPortal. If unset the username field will not be shown and the output will always the pre-configured username.

Whether the password should be saved with the workflow. Note that, if saved, the password can be revealed with modest effort by looking at the encryption algorithm used in KNIME's (open) source code. If the password is not saved (option not set) the user will be prompted for the password when the workflow is opened unless the node is already saved executed. In the latter case the password is not prompted assuming downstream consumer nodes, e.g. a DB reader, are also executed and no longer need the credentials. In such cases (resetting and) executing a downstream node will fail as the password is not part of the credentials object passed from this node into the workflow - a re-configuration of this node is required.

option.name: Use KNIME Server Login (when run on server)

fullDescription.option: If the node is executed as part of a job on the KNIME Server Web Portal the password is populated with the user credentials the log-in user. Please note that this option is not supported if your KNIME Server is configured to use single sign-on (SSO) via OAuth/OIDC.

When the server login and password are used it might be desirable to not display any input fields. When checking this option the component will not display, but user name and password are still retrieved from server login credentials.

knimeNode.interactiveView: Displays a credentials input field which represents the string value.

ports.outPort: Variable output (credentials) with the given variable defined.
